data.question: What is the synthesis condition for the formation of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py?
data.answer: Reaction of a solution of [Cu(CH3CN)4][PF6] in methanol with deprotonated 2-[3(5)-pyrazolyl]pyridine (2-(3(5)-pzH)py) affords yellow-orange plates of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py upon recrystallization from pyridine.

data.question: What is the role of sodium ethoxide in the synthesis of [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py?
data.answer: Sodium ethoxide is used to deprotonate 2-(3(5)-pzH)py before reacting with Ag(O3SCF3) to yield [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py.

data.question: How is the Tl(I) analog of the trinuclear system synthesized?
data.answer: The Tl(I) analog is synthesized by stirring Tl(OEt) and 2-(3(5)-pzH)py in EtOH followed by recrystallization from pyridine to yield colorless crystals of [Tl(2-(3(5)-pz)py)]n.

data.question: What evidence supports the existence of weak M(I)−M(I) (M = Cu, Ag) attractive interactions in the absence of any supportive bridging ligation?
data.answer: The structure of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py reveals two virtually planar triangular copper units coupled via two Cu−Cu interactions, indicating the existence of weak Cu(I)−Cu(I) attractive interactions in the absence of any supportive bridging ligation.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py involves the use of sodium ethoxide.
What distinguishes the structure of [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py from [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py?
data.answer: The structure of [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py is isomorphous to [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py, but its structure is slightly more distorted with the inversion-related triangular silver units being coupled along the longer Ag(1)···Ag(3) side by a pair of Ag−Ag contacts.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of [Tl(2-(3(5)-pz)py)]n does not involve the use of sodium ethoxide.
What is the significance of the Cu···Cu distances in the structure of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py?
data.answer: The Cu···Cu distances in the structure of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py provide clear evidence of the attractive nature of the Cu(1)−Cu(3‘) and Cu(3)−Cu(1‘) intertriangular interactions.

data.question: True or False: The structure of [Tl(2-(3(5)-pz)py)]n demonstrates one-dimensional chain structures devoid of metal−metal interactions.
How does the synthesis of [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py differ from that of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py?
data.answer: The synthesis of [Ag3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py involves reacting Ag(O3SCF3) with the deprotonated 2-(3(5)-pz)py anion, while the synthesis of [Cu3(2-(3(5)-pz)py)3]2·2py involves reacting [Cu(CH3CN)4][PF6] with the same deprotonated anion.
